divs: sighting details at 9:43pm on 10-12-10, i was standing on my pourch letting my dog go to the bathroom. i looked up and saw a small flashing light moving north to south. i watched for a few seconds as it changed from blue to red and then to yellow. the flash was constant, as was the slow movement. i noticed right away that it made no noise, and there wasn't any other aeroplane in the sky at that time. i went inside and grabbed my cell phone to take a video of it. i videoed it for 1 and 1 1\4 minutes before it was obstructed by trees above my house. i then took my dog inside, and followed it with my eye as it went across the sky for another 2 minutes or so. i finally lost sight of it as it went over the horizon. i rush inside to looked on "www.flightstats.com" to see if any aeroplanes were flying over my house at that time, and could find none. i live in arlington, texas. so i am very familar with aeroplanes in the sky, as i live in the flight paths of 4 major airports. this objest seemed to be moving to slow for an aeroplane, and it made no noise. it also seemed not to have the same lights as aeroplanes do, like on the wings, and the flashing faa lights. as a member of mufon, i tried to take a good video of the object, by keeping the house next door in the frame, and keeping the camera as still as possible. that was the only thing in the sky for at least another 5-7 minutes, and it was quiet, (no aeroplane noise). interresting note, about an hour before my sighting, (8:45pm) my lights flickered, and then i heard a big "boom" like an electric transformer blew. this also happened again, around 30 minutes later, (10:20pm). again, my lights flickered for a split second, and then i heard a "boom", but far away this time. the power never went out, and nothing happened after that. i doubt it's related, but thought i would mention it.
Summary: Small light in sky flashing with blue, red, and yellow, moving north to south.
trends: There have been 43 other sightings in Arlington
There were no other sightings in Arlington on or around October 12th 2010
This sighting has never been favorited.
